about.title: About MycoNurseries
about.subtitle: Promoting Sustainability Through Fungiculture
about.text1: MycoNurseries is a non-profit promoting sustainability fungiculture. We do this primarily through growing oyster mushrooms from discarded organic matter and fostering an inclusive and diverse community passionate about fungi.
about.text2: Based on the McGill University Campus, MycoNurseries collects used coffee grounds from local coffee shops and uses them as food for the oyster mushrooms.
about.text3: After harvest, these mushrooms are donated to projects addressing food insecurity on campus.

growingProcess.title: Our Mushroom Growing Process
growingProcess.text: Learn how we turn recycled organic waste into nutritious oyster mushrooms.

team.title: Meet the Team
team.text1: Our team is a group of passionate individuals working together to promote sustainability through innovative fungiculture solutions.
team.text2: We’re dedicated to fostering community, learning, and sustainability at every step.

about.title: About MycoNurseries
about.story: MycoNurseries was started by Julia Wright and Daniel Cha, who wanted to make a difference in their community through their passion for fungi.
about.growth: Over the past two years, MycoNurseries has become a Montreal-based non-profit dedicated to promoting sustainability through fungiculture and the only organization growing mushrooms on the McGill University downtown campus.
about.howWeCreate: How We Create a More Sustainable Community
about.intro: We currently create a more sustainable community in three ways:

sustainableSubstrate.title: Sustainable Substrate
sustainableSubstrate.text1: We grow oyster mushrooms, and these mushrooms need ‘food’ or substrate to live off of.
sustainableSubstrate.text2: 40% of the food we give our mushrooms is coffee grounds that otherwise would’ve been thrown into the landfill, where studies have shown they generate greenhouse gases and have a variety of bad environmental effects.
sustainableSubstrate.text3: So far we’ve diverted over 40kg of used coffee grounds from landfills.

community.title: Community
community.text1: We have over 30 volunteers who help us grow the mushrooms.
community.text2: These volunteers are all students or young people and through participating in growing sessions, they learn about sustainable urban agriculture.Through the community we create, we hope to inspire these volunteers with a love of nature that will make them more passionate about helping the environment.

foodSecurity.title: Promoting Food Security
foodSecurity.text: We donate the oyster mushrooms we grow to SNAC, a group that provides free produce to members of the McGill University community facing food insecurity.We’re proud of this initiative because we believe that in addition to having access to foods which will satiate them, everyone deserves access to a variety of fresh produce to have a high quality diet.

supportAndPlans.title: Our Support & Future Plans
supportAndPlans.text1: Over the past two years, we’ve received funding from the Sustainability Projects Fund, McGill University Faculty of Engineering Global Challenges Award Program, and Canada Service Corps’s Sprout Fellowship.
supportAndPlans.text2: Currently, we’re receiving support from the Dobson Centre for Entrepreneurship as we complete the McGill Dobson Bootcamp and Cup.
supportAndPlans.text3: As we look towards the future, we’re hoping to develop an educational module around circular economies and waste management,to reach more people in the McGill University and broader Montreal Community.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text1: Get in touch with MycoNurseries today!
contact.text2: If you have any questions, comments, or are interested in collaborating with us, our contact form is a good place to start.
contact.text3: Fill out the relevant information and someone from the MycoNurseries team will get back to you soon.

form.title: Contact Form
form.thankYou: Thank you! We’ll get back to you soon.

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.text1: We’d love to hear from you. Please fill out the form below.
getInvolved.thankYou: Thank you! We’ll get back to you soon.

sponsorUs.title: Sponsor Us
sponsorUs.text: Stay tune for our sponsorship teaser to learn more about us.

partners.title: Our Collaborators & Supporters
partners.text: Meet the organizations and individuals supporting us!

spf.title: Sustainability Projects Fund (SPF)
spf.text1: The Sustainability Projects Fund (SPF) builds a culture of sustainability on McGill campuses by developing and funding interdisciplinary projects.
spf.text2: The SPF is the largest fund of its kind in Canada, valued at $1 million annually.
spf.text3: Since 2010, over $10 million has been allocated to more than 260 projects.
spf.text4: We received seed funding from the SPF to kickstart our project, which helped us secure a place in the McGill University Phytotron and produce our first batch of oyster mushrooms.

sproutFellowship.title: Sprout Ideas Fellowship
sproutFellowship.text1: The Sprout Ideas Fellowship provided MycoNurseries CEO and board member Julia Wright with a seed grant, skill building, and mentorship.
sproutFellowship.text2: The fellowship is funded in part by Canada Service Corps and empowers youth aged 15 to 30 to gain experience and skills while giving back to their community.
sproutFellowship.text3: Through this program, Julia completed several learning modules to become a better social innovator and is expanding the mushroom growing process with the seed grant.

globalChallengesAward.title: McGill University Faculty of Engineering Global Challenges Award
globalChallengesAward.text1: The McGill University’s Faculty of Engineering Global Challenges Award provides undergraduate students with experiential learning opportunities to gain experience in teamwork, leadership, and communication.
globalChallengesAward.text2: Through this award, we hired Michael Li as an intern in the summer of 2024. He developed a sensor system to monitor growing conditions and helped with operations.

dobsonCentre.title: Dobson Centre for Entrepreneurship
dobsonCentre.text1: The Dobson Centre for Entrepreneurship is the hub of entrepreneurship at McGill University.
dobsonCentre.text2: Its mission is to teach, coach, and support entrepreneurs from across the university in building innovative companies with a purpose.
dobsonCentre.text3: The center provided coaching and development to MycoNurseries members who completed the 2024 Dobson Weston Innovation in Sustainability Lean Program.
dobsonCentre.text4: They are now semi-finalists in the McGill Dobson Bootcamp and Cup, where they are learning about operating a non-profit and preparing for a pitch competition in April.
